mdRecord.dcterms:title: Harvey's Scenes of the primitive forest of America, at the four periods of the year: spring, summer, autumn & winter / engraved from his original paintings ; accompanied with descriptive letter-press
Scenes of the primitive forest of America
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Harvey, George, approximately 1800-1878
Irving, Washington, 1783-1859
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Published by George Harvey, 16 Foley Place, Great Portland Street, & Messrs. Ackermann & Co., Strand ; Printed by Johnson & Co., 10, Brooke Street, Holborn
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Cover imprint same as title page imprint.
Dedication to Queen Victoria is dated January 1842.

Plates are numbered 2-5; Plate 2 has imprint "Engraved by W.J. Bennett N.A. from the original painting by G. Harvey A.N.A."; Plate 3 has the same wording but with "W.I. Bennet"; engraver's name is not present on plates 4-5.
Also published with New York imprint. Cf. BAL 10160.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Original black paper boards with leather backstrip; cover title within an elaborate gilt border. Paul Mellon bequest, May 12, 2000.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mellon, Paul--Library--Personal copy.
United States--Description and travel--Pictorial works.
